title: Luminary Virtual Event: Conservation in Conversation
hero_caption: Joseph E. Yoakum. Grizzly Gulch Valley Ohansburg Vermont (detail), n.d. The Museum of Modern Art, gift of the Raymond K. Yoshida Living Trust and Kohler Foundation, Inc., obj. 255336.
short_description: Francesca Casadio and Mary Broadway of Conservation Science take you inside the museum's labs to discuss their preservation of works by artist Joseph Yoakum.
list_description: Francesca Casadio and Mary Broadway of Conservation Science take you inside the museum's labs to discuss their preservation of works by artist Joseph Yoakum.
description:
In anticipation of the upcoming exhibition Joseph E. Yoakum: What I Saw, Francesca Casadio, associate vice president and Grainger Executive Director of Conservation and Science, and Mary Broadway, associate paper conservator, take you inside the museum's labs to discuss their preservation of works by Yoakum, revealing details about his process and materials that, until now, only a handful of visitors to his studio had been privy to.  

ABOUT THE SPEAKERS

This event is exclusive to Luminary members, and advance registration is required. Details and instructions on how to join the Zoom meeting will be emailed in advance of the event.

Questions? Please reach out to us at luminary@artic.edu. For questions related to accessibility accommodations, please email access@artic.edu.
